website_summaries.verdict: With its beautiful design and high functionality, the DMoose cable management box is a must have.
pros: The aesthetically pleasing wood and white design looks stunning on hardwood floors
This box is made of fireproof ABS material and has plenty of ventilation
The rubber bottom ensures no slipping and sliding
There are conveniently located slits along the sides and top of the box for your chargers to poke through
We loved the curved top – your phone will rest safely on top with no fear of it falling off
cons: The DMoose logo is quite large and a bit of an eyesore on the front of the box

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: OMG this is EXACTLY the right product for my cabe problems! I had 8 feet of satellite cable, a power strip, TV power cables, interconnect cables and a power cord for an electric fireplace All of the fit in the larger box! !! Looks awesome bit more importantly it keeps my pets safe...my number one concern. Here is a photo of how mych it holds! Super product!
customer_reviews.author: Syaronn

customer_reviews.title: Not what you think you’re ordering.
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived smushed in, very unsightly. DMoose logo was apparently half-heartedly slapped on by a drunken milk cow the same night she caught her bull getting randy with the entire angus pen; i.e. folded and full of bubbles. Very cheap and unprofessional build quality. Lid does not sit properly into box, and the cable routing holes are very slim. Using my 12 slot surge protector inside of it, I can barely get all the cables to route through the box to my entertainment setup.
customer_reviews.author: zev

customer_reviews.title: this is literally one of the BEST products I've ever found/purchased
customer_reviews.text: As someone who buys a LOT from Amazon, this is literally one of the BEST products I've ever found/purchased. I hate clutter, but I have a ton of stuff, and organization is a must for me. I have seen a million tricks for hiding cords and cables before, but none of it was really that appealing. This thing is amazing. Just amazing. It holds my power cord, all my cables, it's so spacious, and neat looking,and a million times better than having a heap of cords laying on the floor next to my bed.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna Russo

customer_reviews.title: Printed picture
customer_reviews.text: The "wooden style" plastic is a very cheaply printed picture not a plastic made to look like wood as I thought. Would have been nice still if the plastic wasn't so cheap and thin. The "wooden" siding top piece on the one I received was bowed in the middle. Didn't seem worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Mahoosive
customer_reviews.text: With the tangle or wires getting ever bigger I wondered if you could get an attractive box to stuff it all in. This is the closest I could find to an attractive box. Most of them are just black or white plastic. This has a wood pattern on the top and so it's slightly less intrusive.It's still pretty cheap feeling and is definitely not good for value for the $30 I paid for it. Half of that would've been more reasonable. It's also enormous. You can get a 6way outlet adapter, laptop chargers and tablet chargers all inside. So you end up with one fat outlet cable going in, and all the skinny power cables coming out.
customer_reviews.author: Britincali

customer_reviews.title: The large is big enough...
customer_reviews.text: The large is big enough to hold a long & wide power surge with adapters plugged in and room for excess cables. There are plenty of slots to direct your cables. The woodgrain look even though it's plastic is a nice look. The whole woodgrain top comes off easily and goes back on easily, there is flex to it which makes it easy. I am very happy with this. 4* on durability instead of 5 is that it is plastic and if too rough with it, it might break but you would have to be really rough.
customer_reviews.author: Sanmar

customer_reviews.title: Nice box to hide your surge protectors!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it was larger than I imagined (not like there weren’t measurements I could read or anything lol), but it works perfectly for the 500 plugs we have connected to our TV stand surge protector. Looks nice, too! I have another one fir our other shelving unit that houses a record player, a lamp, and some other things in our living room. I really do dislike the look of chords, and this will help control the eye sores! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Evie A.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I sent this back. How amazon could make this amazon choice could only mean their markup is high. This is poorly made. Spend more and get something made of bamboo. Really nice workmanship and sturdy, nice to look at on the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hides unsightly cables and cords!
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what I wanted and hid our eyesore of jumbled cables near our tv! It’s not cheap, but worth it for my sanity. It’s mostly plastic, but I think it looks sleek. It made a huge visual improvement in an area that has felt messy every time I look at it. Also has made cleaning and dusting that area a breeze. I honestly like it so much, I’m debating on purchasing a second one for the area near the computer.
customer_reviews.author: dw

customer_reviews.title: An expensive plastic box cut to fit its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is quite the expensive piece of plastic! Because of it’s price point, I didn’t think it would look cheap, but it sure does. It hides your cables and power strips as it says it does, but it looks cheap and it has a tacky huge logo on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful problem solver
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I have found for managing all the wires and cables at my computer area...two computers, a printer, special landline with answering machine, and a lamp.... all fit well in one box! I use wire wrap for the wires to keep them gathered and whole area looks great!!! Bought second one for reading area in living room where another batch of wires live. Sturdy and good looking. Will order a couple more for sewing room and bedroom. Thanks for a real problem solver....
customer_reviews.author: Barbara G. Conley

customer_reviews.title: Looks Like a Good Solution....Not So Much
customer_reviews.text: The top was warped when I opened it. Had a cheap feel to it. Not worth the $$$. Am returning.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Way overpriced for a plastic box.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so my boyfriend put this on his wishlist and I thought this was some fancy serge protector thing or something. Dude it's literally just a plastic box, there is nothing fancy or special about it, the only thing that is different from the $10 cable organizer boxes you can get from ikea is that this one has a strip of fake wood. From a distance, it is nice looking, but seriously, wayyyyyy overpriced. This thing probably cost $2 to produce.
customer_reviews.author: Lilaabean

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, disappointed with quality as item was warped.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea! Unfortunately, it didn’t arrive in acceptable condition. It appears to have been warped by time or heat or maybe even both. Such a great idea for cord management. I put them a way (I purchased 2) for use in an inconspicuous place as the warping doesn’t affect its function - i purchased it to use in a location. That would be visible.
customer_reviews.author: CINDY GROVE

customer_reviews.title: Premium Price Tag for a Product That Doesn't Meet Basic Quality Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe how cheap this felt when I arrived. I would have expected a product that felt substantial & was able to clip together solidly. Instead I received something that falls to pieces & bends easily. This did not fit my MacBook Pro charger brick plugged into a power strip inside. I'd buy this product at the $7-$15 price point, but not for $30
customer_reviews.author: Corey Graft

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Project
customer_reviews.text: This box was the perfect final touch on my project. I cannot stand the messy, chaotic look of loose wires and my son's top bunk needed a power source for his gaming system/TV. This box fixed my power strip dilemma, just drilled a few holes through the back to mount it on the wall and it even matched the color of the shelves I built.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Definitely overpriced! The photos make it look quite solid. However, it is quite flimsy and very thin. It does keep my 1 year olds from playing with the power strip (no more resetting the alarm clock over and over again), which is why I purchased it. However, I was very disappointed by the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Looks the part, but would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The best way I can put it is it looks nice from afar, but design and quality are just lacking. Feels cheap, The lid will not close if cables are not going through the cable paths. ( not very user friendly with thick cables, especially if you end up with a power cable that just barely reaches but will lift the lid up ever so slightly) I would recommend spending that extra $4 difference for a BlueLounge CableBox that has a vertical clearance for cables and the lid to close.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Nice style, bit overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I like the box organizer, it does help make your cable situation better. The product is a bit overpriced. The look is nice, but it feels like cheap thin plastic. I've purchased 2 other organizers at half price, and even those seem to have a bit thicker walls that won't crack with a foot kick. This is a $14.99 to me.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Best cables organizer!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m editing this review because I didn’t know what I was doing when I first started trying to use it. My goodness, this is the best thing ever to hide and organize all those cables messed up under and around the desktop (and desk area of course!) my computer repairman was over and laughed when he saw what I tried and then what I ended up using it for which I’d like to decline saying so in this review, lol. This is an excellent product, bottom line!!
customer_reviews.author: Joellyn

customer_reviews.title: Great size for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great size for the price. Works well with basic power/ethernet/video/audio cables. Could benefit from thicker plastic to hold stubborn coaxial cable - it was difficult to route the coax at an angle that didn't cause the structure of the DMoose box to warp or struggle to stay closed. We've only had the box for a day but I also worry that our small dog will be able to chew the thin plastic corners. I purchased with the intent to dog-proof the raised TV stand. Time will tell, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Zac Tishey

customer_reviews.title: All Plastic no wood.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great in the photos but it's just cheap plastic with a wood pattern sticker. 8/23/2017 I stand behind my review but I bumped it up from 1 star to 3 stars because of the great customer service from DMoose. 6 hours after posting my review, a member of the DMoose team reached out to me to let me know that they were sorry that I was unhappy with their product and apologized for the inconvenience of having to return it. I'm a firm believer that there is something to be said for good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: T.J. Boots

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, pretty easy for a child to get into
customer_reviews.text: The "wooden" design is simply a pattern wrap so save yourself some money and get a plain color instead. The device works as intended and is easy to use. However, it's not going to keep kids out for very long, so still try to get your nicely hidden cords out of reach.
customer_reviews.author: SilverJade451

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold many cords
customer_reviews.text: This looked good, but I had to return it because it was so cheap, and the wooden part that covers the cords is actually plastic, or at least plastic-feel! Also, any more than just a few cables will make the top bulge off the base, so you're left with a cord mess, anyway.
customer_reviews.author: CarolaV

customer_reviews.title: but one of the longer edges of the cover has a cutout running along most of the edge that's perfect for poking through cable end
customer_reviews.text: Very attractive cable box with sufficient cable routing options. It's not well shown in the pictures, but one of the longer edges of the cover has a cutout running along most of the edge that's perfect for poking through cable ends and not having them fall back in. The subtle indentation in the cover works well for keeping small items (earbuds, etc) in place while charging. While the cover is not real wood, it's done with a printing process that doesn't look cheap at all. Especially if the box is kept on the floor, the cover looks just fine from a distance.
customer_reviews.author: Grisha Levit

customer_reviews.title: Lovely and functional!
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the pics, I had a mess: router and 2 modems plus spaghetti tangle of cable and wires. The Moose happily handled the spaghetti mess. I combined the Moose with a large decorative box (purchased from Amazon) and created my own inexpensive solution to an ugly mess. Normally I would be ok with routers and modems being visible, but the only viable location for my cable was the formal dining room. Problem solved!!
customer_reviews.author: Rita J.

customer_reviews.title: No power strip provided
customer_reviews.text: The box is nice and i think it will be relatively easy to keep clean. It’s good if you want to use a particular power strip and it will hold a pretty large one. However some of the other brands have an power strip that exactly fits.
customer_reviews.author: Robin NYC

customer_reviews.title: Attractive Design that Serves its Purpose
customer_reviews.text: Great cable management organizer that has improved the look of my home office. Very attractive design. I will definitely purchase this brand and design again if I need a second cable management organizer.
customer_reviews.author: T Carter

customer_reviews.title: Works, but cheap material that’s obvious visually. Not intended for decorative use
customer_reviews.text: Does as intended but very cheaply made and obviously cheap in person, the lid even dents in since it’s such flimsy material. Does as intended by hiding cords, but not as tasteful as the description and photos lead you to believe.
customer_reviews.author: Launa Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to hide the ugly cords that we have lying around. It solved that problem. I read a lot of reviews that said the item looks cheap and although I agree slightly I don't think it's that bad of a look. I got the white with wood on top and if you're not touching it you don't really realize it's plastic. I think I will probably purchase more in the near future for other cords that I have in cluttered corners.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Randall

customer_reviews.title: what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I've been looking for! I had a surge protector and lots of long cords for modem/router/other power cords just sitting on the floor, getting pushed around by my Roomba- not any more! The box organizer was long & wide enough to easily fit my surge protector, and tall enough for all of the cords sticking up and out of the protector. There are small openings on both the long and short sides of the box to allow the cords out, while still able to close it all the way. Wood grain on top looks nice, even if it is on plastic. Very happy with my purchase, may get another in the future!
customer_reviews.author: TammyO

customer_reviews.title: Perfect amount of space for all the cables and crap ...
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for for my kitchen island. Perfect amount of space for all the cables and crap we have plugged in to that area. 2 cell phones, TV, Internet station. I'm glad the sticker peels off. I actually would have liked a version all in wood or a wood and black combo. But this works great and looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R. Travis

customer_reviews.title: Keeps everything nice and organized!
customer_reviews.text: Heads up the that curved top is also concaved. The cable slot on the back is ideal for putting things like a dock or phone on top, but doesn't look as nice because the top isn't level. Still, great product and really cleaned up the cable clutter without me having to get super elaborate and leaves everything conveniently located and accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Fitzy

customer_reviews.title: and the wood grain isn't super realistic, however
customer_reviews.text: These boxes are a bit over-priced for what amounts to a plastic shoe box, and the wood grain isn't super realistic, however, it does the job well and makes a mess of cables look much more presentable. I've purchased a few of these cable management boxes, and they do a great job of taking a mess of cables and allow you to have a cleaner appearance. It's unfortunate that they're as expensive as they are, but I feel overall that they're worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: paulnp

customer_reviews.title: It Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Wavered between 3-4 stars. It's a plastic box as described. No wood. And maybe that's not a bad thing. Not a big deal and it looks okay. I wouldn't use it on a floor, because if it is stepped on it won't take much weight to break it. A little over priced imo. When I opened it, my first reaction was "this is kind of cheap feeling". DMoose's description is accurate though. Organizes my tangled outlet mess nicely.
customer_reviews.author: DSA

customer_reviews.title: Liking it so far
customer_reviews.text: This is the first cable box I've purchased, but I'm very happy with it so far. Only thing is, I have to remember to put the lid back on to achieve the desired effect.
customer_reviews.author: FrecklesNOLA

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little box; it doubles as a shelf between the bed and nightstand and holds all the crazy wire/spaghetti that keeps my gear charged.
customer_reviews.author: F. Wincek

customer_reviews.title: Classy way to hide the cords!
customer_reviews.text: What a nice way to keep the power adapters and cords hidden. This box sits on the floor underneath my tv cabinet and it almost blends in with the cabinet. The courds are completely hidden from view and the back of the tv stand doesn't appear junky and cluttered. A great find for me!
customer_reviews.author: HeyCath

customer_reviews.title: cheaper plastic, poor printing
customer_reviews.text: Quality of this product has gone down. Made from thinner, more flexible plastic and printing is notably poor for logo. Wood print bleeds onto backside. :(
customer_reviews.author: Brad Fox

customer_reviews.title: Good product but not Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The unit that I received is a little damaged. The top cover has a dent. It locks very well and has enough room for big adapter and cables.
customer_reviews.author: Nitesh Jain

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic, but nice look.
customer_reviews.text: Product is cheap plastic and just a fancy looking container. If the wires are thick enough (i.e., extension cord), it doesn’t do well holding it in. It looks nice though. It also has a large dip at the top and am not sure why. In retrospect, I could have gotten one for $15 versus $25 and got my money’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: smooth and easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, strong, smooth and easy to operate. It blends in with walls, furniture and floors. I have some of another brand that is just flat white or solid black, sticks and binds at joints making them hard to open and close; DMoose brand is much more user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Seals

customer_reviews.title: Elegant design
customer_reviews.text: I love this cable manager! I was able to conceal about 8 unwieldy and ugly cables. This is an elegant solution to an every day problem typical of having a myriad of devices. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Mark White

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and hides the cords.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t know I needed one of these until I started to use it. Very happy with purchase does an amazing job at hiding your mess of cords.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo R

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says. I'm having a hard ...
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says. I'm having a hard time getting it to stay shut, but that's just because one of my cords pops up at an odd angle, and the cover does not latch closed. If you have normal plugs, this will probably not be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Momsy

customer_reviews.title: Can't have just one
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for placing all your cords in. It's convenient and I use it so no cords will get stuck when I vacuum. It looks nice enough to have it out. I ended up buying two.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie

customer_reviews.title: Hides Cords in Style
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cable management box, really cleans up my space and blends in with my decor well. It has plenty of room for several cords and power strips. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Villalta

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide surge protector and no tape measure so I wasn't sure if all my cables would fit. Everything fit perfectly with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Works okay
customer_reviews.text: It works, but I thought I would have more options for the wires. Plugs do not fit in the holes at the top of the item . There's enough room at the bottom, but wanted to thread more cords.
customer_reviews.author: jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Useful but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is overpriced. The top wood patterned part seems a little flimsy, I’m also not too excited about the huge logo on the side, but it does the job and hides a messy power strip. There weren’t too many other options from my research.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Berry

customer_reviews.title: Too short for MacBook chargers
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit too short for MacBook Pro charger (can’t close the lid), plus the thin plastic box feels flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: sky

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea but the Quality isn't Great
customer_reviews.text: I like the look but the lid didn't fit well and is bowed in. It did wrangle all my cables which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Frech

customer_reviews.title: This was a great size and the concave top allows for a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed to hide the cords from my pups. This was a great size and the concave top allows for a couple of weights so they REALLY can't get in. Hides multiple cords with plenty of access points! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Renata s

customer_reviews.title: Awesome solution to ugly cords
customer_reviews.text: I find tangled cords irritating so I am so happy to find this box. It's attractive and easily accommodates my cords, including surge protector and bulky laptop power cord. The curved lid protects a charging phone from sliding off the edge. I also peeled off the label with no residual goo left on the box.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: This product I think works best in an adult home
customer_reviews.text: This product I think works best in an adult home. I have children and its easy to pop the top off, I would have enjoyed it extensively more if it snapped on, but otherwise it serves a cosmetic purpose and hides the cables.
customer_reviews.author: whitney kellen

customer_reviews.title: Scratched and not great quality
customer_reviews.text: The wood wasn't actual real wood, which is okay, but unfortunately it feels light and flimsy, to the point that it was bowed in. Also the "wood" pattern was scratched up on both corners. The seller does a great job of communicating with their buyers, fortunately, otherwise this product would have received only 1 star
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: Though the final product looks good, I was surprised that it was not very substantial — thin plastic. No matter ... it does exactly what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Cell Geek

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This one looks good, and is large enough for my power strip and all my cables. It does what it's supposed to do. I don't have a problem with the slightly curved top that other reviewers seem not to like. I will be ordering another one.
customer_reviews.author: Saskia

customer_reviews.title: So useful
customer_reviews.text: It was great to get all our TV wires and light wires in one box (fits our extension box) and stop having our Roomba eating up our wires and getting stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Alegna rollak

customer_reviews.title: Consolidates messy cords etc..
customer_reviews.text: It's a little larger than imagined but does allow power strip to be hidden.
customer_reviews.author: Dr A J D

customer_reviews.title: Cable Managment Box
customer_reviews.text: This does an awesome job of managing the charging station I set up in my room, it has space for a large power strip and taller plugs, but it's a little cumbersome to take the lid on and off. It's a little more flimsy than I'd like for the cost, but is good all around for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Goodrich

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, hides the unsightly pile on the floor
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, hides the unsightly pile on the floor. The holes for the cables though, I guess they didn't have PCs in mind. The top stays popped up a bit because I have 8 different cables running out and the hole is jam packed.
customer_reviews.author: Shelobe

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of crap. It must have been left out in the sun. It is warped. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Helps declutter the home office with charger cords and plugins everywhere!!
customer_reviews.text: Initially I thought the organizer box was too big for my needs. Having more rechargers than outlets on the power strip, I labeled all the various plugins and threw them inside the box. Since I recharge my iPad on a daily basis, this recharger cord is always extended outside the box for everyday use. However I have other electronics requiring a recharge about once a month. So I just store the charger plug and cord inside the box and use when necessary. This organizer significantly cut down on all the charger cords and plugins clutter I had laying around the home office. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Cables Away
customer_reviews.text: This is handy and does hide the mess of wires. I will probably get another one for other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: dog lover1

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty bulky but accomplished the hiding of a surge protector
customer_reviews.text: In my case I was trying to use this initially to hide a surge protector and some wires on my mantle. The moose did this but then I went from lose wires to a huge housing unit. I found a better solution for the mantle. As for the product it is now in my office and is used to tidy up some wires.
customer_reviews.author: H. Moser

customer_reviews.title: Bad bow in top, cheaper than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hide the cables and laptop on my desktop. It will definitely still look better than before but the top piece had a very bad bow in it. In the pictures you can see it says almost 1/2". Usable but not as nice as I'd have liked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think there are better products out there, but...
customer_reviews.text: They’re customer service is terrific. I’d definitely do business with them again for this reason alone. As for the product, the top could fit better. But it hasn’t busted under my kids feet yet, so it will definitely hold up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: SENRISA

customer_reviews.title: overpriced box.
customer_reviews.text: It's a glorified shoebox. Don't get the high price tag.
customer_reviews.author: quadruplethreat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Home Accessory!
customer_reviews.text: Power strip fit in perfectly and the slots were ample enough to slide cords in. Slim, not bulky and most of all, not ugly. Very pleasing to my eyes next to the table. I would definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Quality and worked well under the computer desk. Needed to hide all those cables from a new puppy.
customer_reviews.author: tom van handel

customer_reviews.title: Improves room aesthetics
customer_reviews.text: The box looks pretty good and is quite spacious to hold a decently sized power strip. The build is pretty flimsy (you shouldn't have it anywhere such that people can step on it anyways) and the price is IMO on the higher side...but that's the price to pay for fashion.
customer_reviews.author: Cluckers

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Great storage for the multiple cords we all have. Looks great and keeps all of my cords organized. I love that I can lay my devices on top!
customer_reviews.author: cynthiamcintyre

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It’s not exactly what I thought it would be but that against the product. It blends well and was easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: C.Y.N

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept with a neat design!
customer_reviews.text: This box is interesting. It hides the cables just as it says it does, and can be used as a little stand for something. (Nothing too heavy, as the inside is hollow, but it can easily hold up a small plant or router, etc) I love this thing under my desk. I use it to cover the power cable which I have a nasty habit of pulling with my feet. I also use it as a foot rest.. don't stand on it though.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F.

customer_reviews.title: WORKS
customer_reviews.text: received what I ordered and it keeps all the wires in order. Much neater and easier to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Fouse

customer_reviews.title: Works just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: ""I own several of these boxes and they are wonderful for hiding all of my wires and cords. Surge protector strip fits right inside.""
customer_reviews.author: Pat Brey

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough
customer_reviews.text: It does not fit our double power bar plus cords. Because of this, the top does not close. Disapointed only in the size delivered.
customer_reviews.author: K&R

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Got the first one and the top was deeply indented. I thought it was just the one I got, so returned it for a replacement. That one was the same as the first- badly indented. Poorly made product. I expect the top of a box to be flat, not indented where it decreases the area inside the box. Kinda defeats the purpose of being a box.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Smart & Functional
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty functional device that can certainly help clean up cord clutter... and shield power strips from vacuum cleaners and toddler hands.
customer_reviews.author: skip

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but a little warped
customer_reviews.text: These are fine, but I ordered two and each came with the same slightly warped/bent lid. It still looks ok and gets the job done, but it could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Sean A.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job without any issues.  Happy Customer!
customer_reviews.text: Covered the multiple plugs, etc. Looks great against our hardwood floors and truly eliminates the gathering of dust and the unsightly mess of plugs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Paula M. Spedden

customer_reviews.title: A good wire collection box would be better if wood made
customer_reviews.text: Did not expect it to be thin plastic material, thought of made of wood, but overall still a good wire collection box.
customer_reviews.author: Yan Yan

customer_reviews.title: Pos.
customer_reviews.text: this flimsy thin plastic shell is not worth much.. definitely not worth what I paid for. I wad extremely disappointed in how the entire top seems to be warped in and down. Pathetic and a waste of my money. It doesn't really close shut
customer_reviews.author: isabella georgantes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, all my cables are now hidden and easy to access. My wife can't be happier
customer_reviews.author: Camilo Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Do the job but doesn't close well
customer_reviews.text: It's a little hard to close the lid, you have to manage your cable inside.. which is a little bit disappointing compare to their other box they used to had.
customer_reviews.author: Brice P

customer_reviews.title: Looks so much better
customer_reviews.text: I should have put the pictures in before and after, but you get the idea. Helps to keep the cats from getting tangled up.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Matolich

customer_reviews.title: Contains the mess
customer_reviews.text: Great looking box. I’m using it to contain my surface docking station and cable connections. It is sitting on top of my desk so I wanted something a little cooler than the typical black plastic box.
customer_reviews.author: jdub71

customer_reviews.title: A lighter and less sturdy variant
customer_reviews.text: This is good for less visible areas - like my home office where the only person that sees it is me. The wood-style plastic cover is slightly bowed and in general it is not very sturdy, but for simpler applications in less visible areas it works OK.
customer_reviews.author: Kaya

customer_reviews.title: Do you hate cable clutter? Buy this immediately
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic, simple product that solves a huge problem. There is no complicated setup or anything. Just two pieces, you put the bulk of your clutter inside and put the top on. Really makes cluttered corners look a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Karagajamal

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful!
customer_reviews.text: It does the job as expected but upon receiving the item, it is full plastic. It might look like real wood but its just the skin of it. Also mind that the middle part is con caved inward it is not totally flat. The inside has a lot of space so no need to worry about that. Does the job, well done DMoose.
customer_reviews.author: Review_Source

customer_reviews.title: It does it job but not worth $25.
customer_reviews.text: It does it job but not worth $25. The Belkin 8 outlet plug fits inside the box.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, but not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it has a close color to my desk and my wall. The looking is good, but the product I received feels really cheap. The upper piece of the box is bent.
customer_reviews.author: Ebo Hu

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Over priced for a cheap plastic box. I put it in the Goodwill box and replaced it with a lidded basket (just punched a couple holes it it) that does the job beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Pilar

customer_reviews.title: One (marginal) downside is that the top is plastic and would have been nice if manufactured with real wood
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and does it well. Wish I had gotten one sooner. I have to say that Ikea may have a more cheaper box. One (marginal) downside is that the top is plastic and would have been nice if manufactured with real wood.
customer_reviews.author: The Review Guy

customer_reviews.title: No more wire mess!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love our DMoose cable box! It’s attractive and definitely cleans up the space. I will definitely be investing in more. We live in a small space and surge protectors and wires were hard to hide. It also keeps our cords out reach from the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Worry every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed. Easy to use. Will definitely be purchasing additional boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and part of top cut on the sides helps ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and part of top cut on the sides helps a lot too for cables like charging usb cables that are routed from the top of the desk
customer_reviews.author: Vals

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea and unique product.
customer_reviews.text: It is a cool idea and there isn't really anything like it. Hides my ugly powerstrip and cords.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Beebe

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice on the photo but is very cheaply made, flimsy and overall seems to be a very poor quality plastic. Had high hopes for this one, but ended up returning immediately after unpacking it and looking at it.
customer_reviews.author: Gosia

product_meta.title: DMoose Cable Management Box Organizer for Cords, Power Strips or Surge Protectors, Hide Loose Wires Behind TVs, Home Office Computers, Office Desks, Entertainment Centers
feature_bullets: SMARTER ALL-PURPOSE CABLE MANAGEMENT – This cable management tray with a lid helps hide away power strips, USB cables, surge protectors, TV and video game console games, adapters, and more for discrete home or office use.

IMPROVE AESTHETICS AND REDUCE ACCIDENTS – A home office and desk cable organizer can help prevent power strips or electrical equipment or cords from touching carpet or flooring which can reduce tripping or access by kids or pets for better safety.

PRACTICAL AND SAFE STORAGE SPACE – Our cord organizer features four accessible cable cutouts made with ABS fireproof material for better management behind desks, TVs, or entertainment systems. They even feature non-slip rubber feet for stability.

CONVENIENT CHARGING STATION – Along with hiding away cables or cords this box can be used for powering up small electronics, smartphones, cameras or mobile devices by simply running the cords out of the side and resting your items on top.

TRUSTED DMOOSE LIFETIME GUARANTEE – Like all of our quality of life home products and accessories our desk cable management organizer comes with our lifetime guarantee to ensure your total happiness and a risk-free purchase.
